installation.title: Installation & Setup
installation.subtitle: Through this guide, you'll learn how to install and configure DeepTrans Studio development environment.

prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
prerequisites.description: Before installing DeepTrans Studio, please ensure the following tools are installed:
items: Node.js â‰¥ 18.18 (recommended to use corepack to manage Yarn 1.22.22)
Docker / Docker Compose (for local dependency services or one-click deployment)

installDeps.title: Install Dependencies
installDeps.description: Use corepack to manage Yarn, then install project dependencies.

envConfig.title: Configure Environment Variables
envConfig.description: Copy or create .env.local and fill in according to your actual environment:
envConfig.note: ðŸ’¡ For production environments, please change the database, Redis, Milvus, and object storage to dedicated instances and keep credentials secure.
envConfig.example:
# Database & Cache
DATABASE_URL="postgresql://postgres:123456@localhost:5432/deeptrans"
REDIS_URL="redis://127.0.0.1:6379"

# Authentication & Site Config
AUTH_SECRET="Please generate a random string"
NEXTAUTH_URL="http://localhost:3000"
NODE_ENV=development

# LLM / AI Services
OPENAI_API_KEY="sk-xxxx"
OPENAI_BASE_URL="https://api.openai.com/v1"
OPENAI_API_MODEL="gpt-4o-mini"

# Object Storage & Resources
MINIO_ACCESS_KEY=minioadmin
MINIO_SECRET_KEY=minioadmin
MINIO_BUCKET=deeptrans

# Other Services
STUDIO_HOST=localhost        # Used for Traefik/HTTPS deployment

# Optional: GitHub OAuth, SMTP, Milvus access info, etc.

initDb.title: Initialize Database
initDb.description: Execute database migrations and generate Prisma Client.

commands.migrate: yarn prisma migrate deploy      # or yarn db:push to initialize structure
commands.generate: yarn prisma generate            # Generate Prisma Client
commands.seed: yarn db:seed                    # Optional: Import sample data

startDev.title: Start Local Development Environment
startDev.description: Start dependency services and run the Next.js development server.

step1.title: Start Dependency Services
step1.description: Recommended to use services from Docker Compose:
step1.command:
docker compose up -d db redis etcd milvus minio pdfmath worker
# If you need Attu UI or Traefik, append attu traefik

access.title: Access Application
access.description: Visit http://localhost:3000 to access Studio; Attu (Milvus UI) is exposed at http://localhost:8001 by default.

dockerCompose.title: Run with Docker Compose
dockerCompose.description: Deploy all services with Docker Compose in one command.

step1.title: Prepare Environment Variables
step1.description: Prepare .env / .env.production and ensure STUDIO_HOST points to the external domain.

step2.title: Build Images
step2.command: docker compose build studio worker pdfmath

step3.title: Start Main Services
step3.command: docker compose up -d traefik studio worker
step3.note: Traefik will map ports 80/443 to Studio. Dependency components like Milvus/MinIO/Attu can be started as needed.
